review: I usually like Red Robin. BUT NO. I ordered a well done burger. I like my ground beef well done. Steaks, rare, but red ground beef makes me icky. Josh ordered his medium rare. Ours were the exact same. The burger also had no flavour at all. The manager offered to make me another, but I had no desire to wait. Our tables were uncomfortable, at weird heights. Too tall for me, 5'5 and too short for Josh, 6'1. We've never had that problem before. I have no idea what's up with those seat. Plus, there were 18 (I counted) children sitting all around us. EVERY family there had 2+ kids, SCREAMING. The manager gave me my dinner free, since I didn't eat it anyway. That was nice at least. Oh, also, the side of broccoli in place of fries is a cup the size of cough syrup dose cups. YEAH.

They changed up their menu from when I used to dine here back in high school! The times that I've gone, my dining experiences have been pleasant and the servers pretty attentive when you can get their attention. I've gone recently during lunch hours in which we never had to wait for a seat, guess it depends on the day and times you come in. Just wanted to say that I ordered the Chicken Caprese Sandwich which is a tender grilled chicken breast topped with fresh Mozzarella cheese, balsamic marinated tomatoes and crisp romaine lettuce. Served on rustic ciabatta bread with pesto aioli. LOVED it! Im glad the server recommended it because it fills you up and you can split it with a friend.  I love the unlimited fries, especially adding the Red Robin spices to it.  The only complaint that I have is that it is too darn pricey for some burgers!

This is my second review praising this location. Stopped in here for lunch a week or so ago. My diet I am on due to acid reflux is pretty strict. I asked to have my burger made a certain way and also remove the seasoning from the burger. The waitress took it one step further and had an entire batch of fries made without the seasoning. If you seriously think you get bad service here you need to get your head examined.
Staff is very friendly, service is fast and food is great. The atmosphere is relaxing. The restaurant gets very busy during lunch hour so come earlier, around 11:30a.m. Prices are very reasonable.

We practically dragged ourselves up in this joint after a full day at Six Flags...a mess of sunburns, chlorine filled hair, makeup long melted off, you get the idea. If I was them I would have assumed we were homeless and not paid us any mind.  So, in order to escape the bankruptcy inducing food prices at Six Flags, we did not eat at Six Flags. I was STARVING. My sister wanted to half a salad. Boo, you straight trippin. We have a diet thingy going on so she was just looking out, I get it. We settled on bottomless steak fries and half a salad. This appeased my conscience and stomach; I try not to eat too much beef as it is.  Cue waitress, Sarah. On top of EVERYTHING. I've done my share of waitressing back in the day, and I was blown away. Have you ever had a waitress that you had to ask to STOP giving refills of sodas, chips, bottomless fries, etc., because you were done? My glass was never empty, I was never wanting for more fries. My Nazi of a sister commanded her to take away the fries after the 3rd round, saying we'd had enough, while staring directly at me. Geez, I get it. I must add that the Twisted Caesar salad was amaaaaazing, you wouldn't understand how perfectly cooked chicken and macaroni noodles added to a Caesar salad can blow your mind until you've had this. So, we're asked if we need to-go cups as we wrap it up. No thank you, I had more than my usual share of refills of water and fries. My sister picked up the bill, but I was half tempted to throw my card in for a tip. I know my babysis took good care of her, but service like that deserves no less than 40% MINIMUM. I'm still blown away by the attentiveness of this girl. If my usual waitress Tara is absent (who is also magnificent by the way), Sarah, you are my new backup. Sincerely, your biggest fan (and not in a creepy way, just an I Really Appreciate Magnificent Over the Top Service sort of way).

Renee provided horrible customer service.  She gave me my shake with shake all over the outside, and it was not covered.  She threw her pen at me, and was nasty, rude, and unprofessional.  She should have been fired on the spot but now I must complain to management.  FIVE GUYS BURGERS is across the street and another RED ROBIN is at 1604 & 251 at the Northwoods shopping center. DO NOT EAT HERE.
I like the Red Royal burger. The fries are meh. Ask for Natasha's section. She is an excellent server.

Had a hummus appetizer- hummus was good and cold. bread was good and warm. grilled zucchini  were so ice cold and rubbery right out of the frigator, not very good for his dish, i would suggest fresh grilled zucchini on the plate. Turkey Burger was great.
Has always had great food. Gluten Free Options.I was upset last time I went . Visited two more Red Robins before they admitted that All Red Robins were out of Gluten Free Buns...

What can I say, I love me some Red Robin! Food always comes out quickly and it's great tasting and fresh. Have tried burgers, salads and drinks and everything is always on point. Four stars because I think it's a bit pricey but yay for endless fries :) Check them out!

I have visited a red robin before but this is the first one that gave me a WOW factor.  Came here as a group of 20 to celebrate on of my friends birthday.  I looked at the menu  online prior to coming because I wanted to see what they were offering.  I found the online menu to be very convenient because each menu item had a picture (which I am a very visual person).  We were seated with not much wait time.  (Only half of our party was there). The gentleman took our drink order.  The first time I had the bottomless freckled lemonade.  It was very good!!! I lost count after 3.  I ordered the Avoo Cobb Bo salad (Cobb salad). It was great.  I had the chance to eat some garlic fries. Wow!!  I never knew they were bottomless.  My husband had a guacamole burger and enjoyed ever last bite of it.  My daughter had a tavern burger which she almost ate all of it.  We had some good laughs,  great food,  awesome service  and a birthday song.  I didn't give 5 starts because I didn't visit the restrooms.  I don't know the condition of the bathroom.  Sorry people.  I Don't forget they have a groupon available. Take advantage of the 50% savings when you buy a groupon.  I didn't have my phone with me in so I could not take any FOOD PICTURES!! Yum!

I've been a fan of Red Robin burgers for years.  They are reliably good no matter where you go.  I am also a fan of their rewards program.  Doesn't cost anything to sign up.  You are given a card and your rewards are automatically loaded onto your card.   You receive an email whenever you have a reward - which can be freebies or discounts.  I usually go get my free birthday burger every year - The Royal Red Robin with the fried egg YUM! In San Antonio, I like this location.  It is usually not overly crowded.  However, when they are, the servers do an excellent job of keeping the peace and calm.   The kitchen staff must also have a good system in place because the food comes out quickly and everything is hot. There was quite a crowd today for the free Veterans Day meal.  The entire staff was friendly and attentive...thanking all the veterans.  The service was quick.  The food was up to standard.  Good job, Agora Red Robin staff!

My husband and I have been coming here for two years and we love it. The servers know us by name and they have always been accommodating. And...vegan boca burgers with endless fries!!! The sweet and spicy ketchup is to die for! If you want to customize the salads, get a dinner salad and add stuff to it, it's cheaper.

For a family burger experience.  This a great place.  I'm usually slow to pick a chain; however this location exceeded expectations for  choice of quality burgers.  Unlimited fries... But I only need a few.  Great service.   Manager floats during the dining hours and insures staff are all up to his standards as well as the diners.    When it's busy it can be noisy... But don't let that distract from a good place to eat at the Forum area.
Food quality equals 2 stars.  Fries and the fact the kids enjoy themselves equals 4 stars.  Averages out to be 3 stars.

Slow down on the all-you-can-eat fries and fresh strawberry lemonade because their burgers are massive and amazing!!!  They should have a mascot that walks around during lunch and/or dinner that hands out "Robin Eggs" to kids with coupons or something fun inside..

We came in to get seated and the girl at the front said it would be about 5 mins to seat three people-so we sat down and waited. Shortly after sitting down there were two groups of two and a group of three seated...so I walked up to be seated and she asked how many (I know not everyone is remembered but we had literally just been infront of her and were sitting 5 ft away) so I irritatedly said-3. The hostess looked around and had the other hostess go clean off a table real quick so we could sit down. Meanwhile what looked to be the manager in a purple button up shirt, was right next to the hostess desk, drawing on a paper. We go to order food and my son wanted pizza and a side of Mac and cheese, the waitress acted confused and said I'd have to pay for another kids meal of Mac, I said I just wanted to add the side from the adult menu. She was very confused I guess so my son just said "I'll take fries" as he saw she was confused too...he's 9. The waitress did bring us fries before our food came which was a plus. I have never had any complaints at the red robin at the rim, so it was very disappointing to have the confusion at the forum location. Food was good as normal.

I have always received great service at Red Robin, but one instance especially stands out to me. I am a student, so I don't have much money, and my family is rather poor. It is thus very rare for us to have the opportunity to go out to eat at a restaurant together, or for me to be able to go to one with my boyfriend who is also a student. So I was a bit disappointed that one night when we picked up Red Robin for dinner I opened my box at home to discover the burger looking a bit out of order. It was squished, greasy, over cooked, had some things on it I had asked to have taken off, and was overall less than desired. I called Red Robin, not expecting much since we had ordered late and by the time we got home was after 9pm. I was able to speak with a manager who apologized profusely for the food's condition and requested an opportunity to make it up to us. He got my information and had vouchers sent to me in the mail for two free entrees so we would be able to have our dinner together. He had handwritten a note inside to me, and the evidence he had taken the time to take care of me was deeply appreciated. Having as little as we do, it meant so much that he cared enough to make sure we got that dinner. Unfortunately I misplaced the vouchers so I never got to go back, and it is pretty expensive so I would love the opportunity, but this is a great place. I am counting down a star because the original food was displeasing and the price is high (i.e. $5 for a shake).

We came on a Friday night and the wait time was 45 minutes and it looked like a playground inside. This place is definitely a family friendly spot. I think my group was the only one without kids. The food here is OK but the ambiance and atmosphere is loud and distracting.  I am in no rush to return to a Red Robin based on my experience.
This place was pretty good. The price is right for the amount of food you get. Especially the endless fries. The service was pretty good. Good service keeps us coming back!

The general manager of the store did call me as was very apologetic and wanted to give us a meal.  I appreciated the gesture but I turned him down.  I don't do bad reviews to get things but I feel strongly that a restaurant or business  can't fix a problem if they don't know about it.  I don't want someone else to experience what we have.  My goal is to praise great food and service and hopefully make bad service better I know now the store cares.....we still won't go back..... But if you do hopefully your service will be much better

After hearing that darn commercial tune over and over, it was time to see if they lived up to "Red Robin...yuuuum!" The staff was cordial, but seemed rushed even though it was a bit early for "the rush" being only 5pm. (Early birds, I know, but the 2-year old dictated dinner time!)  The appetizer queso was blaaaah and seems heated up in a microwave, so not the best start. My salad was alright, but a fellow diner had a burger and said it was delicious! Overall, an average experience at a just-average chain.

Great service and friendly staff. A great place to take the kids that doesn't involve pizza and people in rodent costumes. The wait was a little long for a table, but given it was a Sunday during the holidays, I was understanding. My only complaint was that the macaroni and cheese could use some work. Kinda bland and no amount of pepper or season salt could give it any flavor. My daughter basically wasted the whole bowl. Burgers are flavorful, though. It's hard not to fill up on bottomless fries and freckled lemonade before the meal comes!

Home of the unlimited basket of fries and I am a fan for life. Yes the fries are awesome with some vampire sauce or spicy ketchup. Food is usually consistent bit if it takes too long then I still have the fries and unlimited refills on the strawberry lemonade. For a couple of bucks more than fast food. It is usually a pretty good option.

This review needs to go into my category of "Chain Restaurants That Rock". I have eaten at Red Robin Burger places from time to time throughout the South and Texas and have never eaten bad food at one. But I saved my review for this location because in my experience it has been the best overall in terms of service and quality of food. It's a tad pricey for a burger but so are a lot of other places.  It could be that my timing is just good because the times I have eaten here has been after the lunchtime crowd or early when they just get started before the big rush hits. Once before the lunch rush and two times afterwards. Never a problem. I always get the same thing at Red Robin. Beer, side salad, and the BURNIN' LOVE BURGER, Babeee! Hell yes! And I always get the DOUBLE! And the meat is delicious.  Here we go so stand witness!: Burnin' Love Burger: crisply fried jalapeno coins, tangy salsa and spicy pepper-jack cheese layered on top of a cayenne-seasoned burger. Lettuce and fresh tomatoes to served on a jalapeno-cornmeal kaiser roll with chipotle mayo. WHOO! Great flavors and that blend together.... like.. you know.. love. And their fries are damn tasty too. Fresh and hot ! QUICK FRENCH FRY TIP: Get them to bring you a side cup of their Chipotle Mayo to dip those fries instead of ketchup.  And while a love relationship may let you down from time to time.. the Burnin' Love Burger has never disappointed me. In fact, the Burnin' Love Burger has never tried to break into my email account, psychotically spied on my phone text messages, ripped up photos of former girlfriends from YEARS ago when they were tucked out of site in a shoebox with other photos, tried to talk shit about me to my friends, called my momma to complain about me, slashed my car tires, broken into my home, nor tried to cock block a new relationship. Just sayin'. This burger is of the Burnin' Love variety that is selfless and soul nurturing and I  actually feel calm after a late afternoon quickie lunch date. And satisfied too.  Red Robin also keeps a decent line of whiskeys and such. They are not all snobby top end types of liquor ..oh you righteous snobs of such indulgences. But remember that you did come to a burger place. Right? You did remember that? So SHADDAPP!! Please save your faux "I'm Gordon Ramsey and just watched a cooking show" review writer bullshit for a more appropriate review. Mmmkaay?  Red Robin gets a five star review for being good at what it does. Ya know..just being a chain burger place and doing it well. Beer, Burger, Fries. And a whiskey afterwards if you want one. Your Yelp buddy Madman will not steer you wrong !  One more thing: Please tell that thar In-N-Out Burger place to get the hell off my lawn!!
Great burgers and friendly service! Can't get enough of the endless fries! Prices are reasonable.

This place is great if you love tons of dressing, mayonnaise and other goopy fats on your food. The Avo-Cobb-O salad was underwhelming and came with two cups of ranch. I'm glad I asked for it on the side. My boyfriend's bacon burger was so loaded with mayo that it was hard to eat and quickly became unappetizing.  My glass of water tasted metallic. The booth we were at was falling apart. Another guest at the booth next to us was wearing pajama pants and house shoes. Classy. It seems to be a popular place, though. When we left there were several groups waiting to be seated. Definitely not a health-oriented place, and come hungry!

Out of all the locations in San Antonio this is my favorite! we drive an extra few miles just to come here. The manager Alden was such a sweetheart and made sure i received my Birthday Burger and fresh hot fries which their Whiskey River Wrap was thick and amazing!! Servers were all polite,friendly, and helpful!!
The food is good but don't go here if you want to have a conversation with your party. We have been here a few times and it's almost too loud (music+people talking Ivette loud music) to be enjoyable.

This place is almost as bad as school lunch in high school. The foods that they recommended were their worst sellers and we found out first hand. Normally the prime chophouse would be good but they completely ruined it along with close to no service while I spectated the chefs and waiters horsing around in the kitchen. Thanks red robin, you're usually good but you disgraced yourself this time.

Disgusting! The place was dirty. What wasn't sticky was greasy. The quality of the food was not good. Onion rings were the only decent thing about our meal. The patty on the burgers resembled the same frozen party you buy from walmart, thin w no natural good flavor. Garlic and herb fries had very little garlic and herb and my guys fries were cold. The bill for two nasty burgers, cold fries, and a tea = $38.
Stopped in for a late meal 30 mins before closing. But you would have never known it, our waiter was attentive and courteous. Great service and great food. Tyler was great!!!!!

WHY DID I Even COME HERE!!!!! I was really hoping this was going to be a great visit. I should have known. The fries  were great kept them coming then i see a hair on the side of the ranch dip cup. Gross. The burger came was tasty then my son was drinking orange juice and I noticed that there was something in it my husband took it out it was something like dirt or mold something that should not be in a cup i was upset cuz it was in my sons cup. The manager came and   apologized and we didn't have to pay  i could not even eat my food anymore i was grossed out. The food is ok here i just wish it was clean here even the menus on the table are dirty.

4 stars for consistency! great food and service!  I'll start by saying that Red robin's burgers are a little toward the pricier side, and the almost $3 drinks add up for a family of 4, but that said, the burgers are always top notch. Great flavor combos, well prepared.  I also like the healthier bun, bun free, side swap options - great if you are trying to shave off some calories. Tonight I decided to try the about-Cobb-o salad instead of a burger. My expectations weren't high - salads seem like a "throw-away" item at some restaurants. I end up digging out old, brown pieces of lettuce, or the salad tastes like old, bagged lettuce. it its just plain iceberg - you get the point. BUT what I GOT was a REALLY fresh, and REALLY good salad! The grilled chicken was very flavorful and not the least bit dry or rubbery. and there was a nice variety of lettuce along with generous portions of diced tomatoes, cucumbers, sliced avocado, bacon and blue cheese crumbles. The accompanying garlic toast was also yummy. NICE surprise at a "burger" restaurant. May be a hard choice for me next time - burger or salad!

There is not much I can say about this particular Red Robin other than when I came to visit it today with my family we received horrible service. They were busy but I find that to be absolutely no justification for poor service. We love Red Robin and have been to several across the country I honestly can say out of the many locations we have visited this would probably rank as the worst service we have ever received.

I went here today with my husband, and we wound up underwhelmed. When we were seated, we noticed that several tables all throughout the restaurant needed to be bussed. There were at least three tables in our section that had half eaten food and drinks sitting on it. We ordered and the food came out in a reasonable amount of time. I got my spiced pumpkin pie shake first, and it was delicious! It tasted like a real pumpkin pie. Next came the food, and I laughed at the amount of turkey in my BLTA Croissant. There were three slices of turkey...just three thin, sad slices. What a rip off. I chose bottomless fruit salad instead of fries, trying to eat a little healthier, and it came drenched in a syrupy sauce. Darn. My husband's Smokin Pepper burger was great and cooked properly, so that's a plus. He was also disappointed in the sugary sweetened fruit salad. By the time we got up to leave, about 40 minutes later, every single table that needed to be bussed when we walked in was STILL dirty. It was pretty unappetizing to look at all the dirty tables while trying to enjoy our meal. Apparently no one was bussing tables; we never saw anyone do it. Overall, we didn't really think it was worth the trip or going back.

My wife and I came here a second time based off the good experience we had a couple of months ago.  The place had about four tables filled (we are early dinner eaters), however we noticed quite a bit of tables were neglected by cleaning staff.  The menu was pretty gross and had a sort of "film" over it.  The waitress was friendly and service was quick.  I did not feel like leaving like I was too full to walk, so instead of bottomless fries, they offer a bottomless fruit cup.  What they fail to mention is that the tony pieces of fruit are drowning in a sugary syrup that was ridiculously sweet.  Probably my fault for ordering fruit at a burger place.  My wife ordered a pumpkin pie shake and BLTA and had to laugh when her dinner arrived with three tiny pieces of cold cut turkey on it.  This plate was $11 mind you.  We spent about 40 minutes eating, and upon leaving, noticed the same dirty, food half eaten tables had STILL not been cleaned off.  Based off of cleanliness, we will not be back.

Never again will I bring my family here. I will be posting the review in the order in which it is happening. It's live folks. Grab some popcorn.  -Asked to sit out side. Completely filthy.  Broken tables and chairs  - asked for my high chair 4 times - found food frozen in my ice in my vodka. Sent it back and there is more food present - ordered my sons food came out wrong - she brought the appetizer after about 30 min then proceeded to drop the whole platter on table we were sitting at ( now we have to move) - forgot my sons drink for the 3rd time - had to get the rest of the food Togo because we didn't have time to eat  - I never tip on my card so I went to get cash from my car ten steps away. She saw the ticket and started crying. I feel bad for her.  Anyway not a good experience. Won't be coming here again.

Awful service. Throughout the entire meal we watched our waitress take awesome care of all the tables around us while basically ignoring us. Literally asking the other guests, "is everything ok, do you need anything?" Then walking right passed us to the next table. She acted like we were a problem from the get go and made us flag her down if we needed something. The only thing she handled quickly was our check like she couldn't wait to get rid of us. We left feeling like we were a pain in her ass.
Waited too long to get drinks...had to ask several times for refills, coffee was burned...server was not attentive or talkative at all, way too expensive for burgers and terrible service.

People with previous negative reviews are morons.  We have been to this location repeatedly at varying times and the food, service and atmosphere has always been consistently good.  Our server ANDRE was superb!

We are avid Red Robin eaters in our town. We were visiting San Antonio and decided to eat there, safe choice so we thought. Well it took the waitress over 5 minutes to get to our table to take our drink order. 3 out of 5 in our party where in the RR. She didn't even ask if we know what they might like to drink. When it came time to order she made me think it was cheaper to do order my son an adult meal because I wanted to add an additional chicken finger to the kids meal ($1.50) extra. Then when my mother order she was telling her what she wanted on her burger and she said create your own. Also the fried where over cooked and stale. I had to request a refill instead of it being just done. To have icing on the top I found a HAIR in my ranch for my French fries. I told the manger and he goes "you want another ranch?" UM No!!! When I received my bill I was shocked by how much I was charged for certain items. I WILL NEVER EAT AT THIS LOCATION AGAIN!!

So despite all the bad reviews we decided to give it a shot. The food and service were absolutely horrible! Our burgers were cold, as were the fries and our drinks always took way too long to get. Not to mention the dessert was awful, the doughnuts are not as good as they look. The only saving grace is that their sugar cocktails are pretty good.  This was my husbands first visit ever to a red robin and it will also be his last. They have seriously gone down hill...... Too bad.

My husband and I just finished eating dinner here.  The best part of our meal was the waitress, who was spot on with service and tending to whatever we requested .  The food  just sucked.  I ordered the BLTA.  What little bit of avocado there was on the sandwich was bland and tasteless.  The turkey was clearly cheap deli turkey and just plain nasty.  My husband  ordered the blackened chicken sandwich and said his bun tasted stale.  The manager walked by our table and asked if we were alright...not how were our meals, did we enjoy them, just if we were alright.  And this was in passing because he never did stop and listen for a response.  We will not be back here wasting our money.  If you want good food go to the 54th St. Restaurant and Drafthouse.  Excellent food.  The waitress we had here tonight should head over there.  She was wonderful.  If I could give negative stars I would.

The angora park location fell quite short on their call in service. I called to place an order to go and 15 and two hostess and then 7 minutes to speak with the bar back to place an order. In this time I finished shopping across the road and now walking through the doors of this establishment. I can understand if you are busy, but the place was not. Poor poor poor service and then while waiting for the order I was knocked out of my chair by a busser rolling a cart of ice. I try to look on the bright side, but this was not even average service. To bad, I know many of my fellow servicemen really enjoy Red Robin. Maybe this one just has poorly trained workers and management today. Oh wow, now the order was wrong after a half hour wait. So they want me to wait longer and I told them I'm late already and then a manager asked me the same thing .  The only thing they did correct and fast was take my money.

Always a good burger, who can pass up bottomless fries!  Awesome service,but i can't understand why they don't have fries ready when they are bottomless. Our second helping of fries were ready when we were done eating
This place is going down hill. Tables need a good cleaning and some maintenance. Food is just ok

The Agora Parkway Red Robin is a great place to eat. It is a good idea to avoid it on a Friday night because of the crowds, but I have never had problems with the food. Sometimes the service can be slow, but these incidents are few and far between. A great place to take the kids!

This is my first visit to this location and I think it is a little better than the others I've been to. I like the burgers and endless fries. They have a good child's menu and my son loved the cod crunchies. Had the usual chill cheese burger with a grilled jalapeño. The only complaint I have is the noise level as with most it is super hard to carry on a conversation while eating. The service was exceptional even with 9 people in our group. Would be higher stars but they need to figure out how to dampen the noise level.

Came here and it was a disappointment. They served a small bowl of fries. They were reluctant to refill our fries. Burger was good. They are known to have bottomless fries..... they were rationing them out.

Family found ourselves here because everyone wanted a burger and I forgot how great they were here.  Bacon cheeseburger: son devoured it completely.   Alamo Burger: salsa, pepper jack cheese and guac was enjoyed by husband Red Robin Cheeseburger: my go to, supposed to come with special relish but server said not anymore (still enjoyable and cooked medium) Daughter hand a BLT crossiant that was huge.  Server was great.  Food came out correct and quickly.  Tasty.  Endless fries. The best thing really! Never ending root beer floats. Son drank 3! No complaints.

A little pricey but bottomless fries, yes please! Very kind server and a great manager, offered us an app because they were out of mushrooms. Very attentive and caring, give them a shot! Delicious! Thank you Amanda!

Typically, I love Red Robin's. However, I will not be returning to this location. Our waiter was MIA, never refilled our drinks, and took 30 minutes to return our credit card. The restaurant was nearly empty, so that's no excuse. My burger was mediocre, and that's not something I've ever been able to say about Red Robin before. They charged 5.99 for maybe 10 fried pickle slices. They didn't have my fried green tomatoes. The bathroom was filthy. This isn't an experience I've ever had at a Red Robin before, and it was very disappointing.

The service is always great when we come here and the Whiskey River Burger is outstanding! We love coming here, because there is rarely a long wait, even on a Saturday night at 7 pm. The kids, my husband and I love this place.

Bad service! We just left here! My husband took the kids all in while I changed the baby's diaper and I slowly walked in to sit down, no one even greeted me although they were at the host stand I just walked past them after my son ran to play at the games, we sat there forever picked our food and sat longer! We never had a server never offered even water or anything so we finally went home! No one even knew we left

Decided to pull in at red Robin and was pleasantly surprised at no wait time but the place was packed .  Well the margaritas were not very strong they were fairly well priced.   Our food came out hot service was really good and place seemed nice and clean it is loud so be prepared for that.

We frequent this location and service is usually pretty good, during our last visit the service was terrible. I was overcharged by 6$ when they added a additional tip to my credit card after we left. We wont be back to this location.

Always great food and service at this Red Robin!  Have never had a bad server here.  Today our server was Breanna and she was friendly and efficient.  If you have this many great servers, no bad ones, and great food, it means great management.  Thanks!

Love the Whiskey River BBQ Burger! That is definitely one of my all time favorite burgers. I also love the fries with campfire sauce. I don't think I could enjoy my meal quite as much without it. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was the place always smells like dirty mop water when I walk in the doors. I don't know if it's just me but the smell permeates the air and makes me thankful for take out. Also, sometimes when I call in my to-go order it will take a while for someone to pick up the phone and then take the order.

Went with my wife to have lunch and it was nice and slow. Ordered a wedge salad to share and that was super yummy. We ordered one of the new burgers (I can't remember the name) but my wife loved it! Thanks for your great service and thank you to the manager for stopping by to check in on us!

We have eaten at this Red Robin since it opened. In general the food is good, we've never had a bad meal. Always enjoy the service. I do wish they would put money into the restaurant as it is in desperate need of a renovation. Booths are starting to fall apart and it's to the point they can't really keep the place clean.

Been eating at Red Robin  for years but this one did not meet RedRobins Expectations.  Order Garlic fries and they had no garlic try telling the server she started telling me how they do it at their Red Robin.  I just want to be able to taste what I order

Despite getting my freckled lemonade poured on top of my head, arm, Apple Watch and leg, the experience was ok. I was taking a picture of our boys and our toddler wasn't looking at the camera so when the waitress, Amanda walked up, she took it upon herself to try and help out by holding the drink over my head to get him to look which ended in disaster. I was very upset with her but I kept my composure. On to the food... it was ok. The fries were warm like they'd been sitting under a lamp. The burger was ok, nothing to brag about. Our oldest son had the burger with the sunny side up egg on it and he enjoyed half of it as the other half was burnt. Our 8 year old had the kid's cheese pizza and he enjoyed it! Especially the bottomless apples. Our toddler got the mini meatballs and fruit cup. He ate a few of them and then started throwing them everywhere. 3 stars for the food. We may come back here but I'll ask for a different waitress if we get Amanda as our waitress.

This is an average burger joint. Nothing special about the burger patties themselves. Reasonable prices and the bottomless drinks and sides is a plus, but I can't look past the blandness of the food.     Atmosphere is nice, our waitress was great, the rest of the crew, meh.

EXCELLENT service! we came in and they were very friendly and we were in a rush and our server Amanda was very excellent! This place was very clean and professional! Amanda was by far one of the best servers we have had at this location. We were in and out in less than 20 minutes! Thanks for taking care of us and attendant to our needs

Veggie Burger!!! OM NOM NOM!!!! All jokes aside, I really enjoyed my experience. The waitresses are super cool and knew the menu very well. Not to mention, they stay on top of their guest. They check consistently but no so much that you very like they're waiting on you to leave to drop them their tip. The bottomless fries came out hot every time which is a rarity based on previous experiences at other locations. Speaking of locations, it's in a plaza area between two reference cities: San Antonio and Cibolo, TX. However, it's far enough away from both that you'll need to prepare for at least a 20 minute drive to include traffic if you're going during rush hour or at the end of your day. They also have balloons for young kids which was great because my son wasn't in the most "happy" of moods when we visited. If you're coming to have an interview or a meeting, this is NOT the place. It gets loud when packed. If you're military, there are military discounts so make sure to pull out the ID card with your smiling face on it. Lastly, the parking lot is the biggest in the world so be Plan accordingly if you have elderly or injured people with you. Overall, I would go there again. In fact, I'll be there tomorrow. Take care, #YelpNation. -Cole

I knew I shouldn't have come here, I've been to Red Robin one other time in 2006 and it wasn't that great. But I was willing to give it a try because on a Friday night I didn't want to drive very far with my two small children and Chillis is getting old. Next time we'll just go to Chillis.  I like to give places the benefit of the doubt, so we went in with a good attitude. The kids ordered chicken, I got an Avo-Cobb-O salad, which I assumed would come with some avocado (Spoiler alter, it had zero avocado in it), my husband ordered the bacon guac burger (which he assumed would have guac in it). Anyway, our server made that right but it took a while. That's fine, they were busy.  The real kicker was my tea. I ordered unsweet tea, which I have been informed was stupid because in the South everyone apparently wants diabetes so they put sugar in every damn thing so it's my own fault for expecting to get what I ordered, and I did get what I ordered. But then someone came by and unbeknownst to me filled my glass with syrup and I had to spit that disgusting concoction into the napkins they gave us.  We went, we ate (less than what we paid for), the service was okay, and we tipped our waitress but we will not be returning.  This crap that passes as food is way over priced.  And my daughter threw up everything she ate from there. Seriously never again.

Well my family and I love Red Robin in California. So we stopped for a bite to eat here and it was not a good experience. The floor manager was nice but she could have removed the kids meal off the bill considering the pizza was cold. So my son refused to eat it. They tried to reheat it which never tastes the same. And usually when you order toppings on a pizza they should be cooked and not just tossed on top like a salad. What 2 yr old will eat raw mushrooms? I'll have to think long and hard before heading back there...
I tried the Bonzai, Southern Charm burger....too good endless fries with ranch and southwest sauce.

This location at the Forum is clean, friendly and fast in service. There are lots of burger choices and since we were on a low carb diet, we tried the burger with a lettuce wrap. It was a great, delicious choice and I opted for a salad instead of fries. Although, from previous trips- those fries are hard to pass up! I love how they have the seasoning salt on the table, so you can add as much as you want. They also have a wide variety of sauces- my favorite is the campfire sauce- a smoky, creamy bbq sauce. Red Robin has a fun ambiance with lots to look at and something on the menu for just about any appetite.
